Topic.Title: Microsoft Is Courting New Developers, But Some Existing Ones Are Still Fuming Over Its Windows 8 Decisions

Message.Msg: Not that any of them are paying any attention to you, but that is evidently the official attitude Microsoft has displayed up to now, and that is one of the major reasons Windows 8 is such a flop up to now, and especially the reason Microsoft Store has been such a flop. Microsoft management used to understand that Microsoft needs its community of independent developers more than they need Microsoft. If management no longer understands that, well, that is just one more sign that Microsoft is being seriously mismanaged.

Message.Title: Do a little "study" on the research that dound Fox vierers with lower I.Q.s
Message.Msg: They should have stuck with an average of 95 or something that is not on the surface of it a lie. The "study" purported H.Q. to be from Alabama actually has a Washington D.C. call back number. Because of ND contracts they cannot reveal the actual study or who funded it. Now, gullible Obama bois, try to think for a minute, how would one survey watched network AND learn that viewers actual I,Q.?????? Well I just sold a pile of real estate so I sent $50K to a research/detective firm in D.C. which found it was not actually Fox viewers tallied but how Obama supporters PERCEIVED Fox viewers. Further, since I was paying for an investigation and a new survey it was discovered that Fox viewers actually had an I.Q. of 104 4% above national average. An additional question found that 69% of those who support Obama found lying an acceptable vehicle to the end of agenda advancement. 62% realize Obama lies with some regularity. 65% want recent scandals swept under the rug so that the welfare checks can continue. The last two questions were the killers though, my study found 22% of Obama supporters were unemployed, almost three times the official national average and of those unemployed Obama defenders the average I.Q. was 87. My study is real and scientifically done, trust me, gullible morons.

Message.Title: Windows 8, PC shipment decline is worst EVER
Message.Msg: Google it. Published two months ago. Quoting: "At this point, unfortunately, it seems clear that the Windows 8 launch not only failed to provide a positive boost to the PC market, but appears to have slowed the market", Bob O'Donnell, IDC vice president, says. Holy Moley, Windows 8 slowed the market? You want to know why Ballmer booted Sinfosky out the door? O'Donnell offers chilling indictment. "While some consumers appreciate the new form factors and touch capabilities of Windows 8, the radical changes to the UI, removal of the familiar Start button, and the costs associated with touch have made PCs a less attractive alternative to dedicated tablets and other competitive devices", he says. "Microsoft will have to make some very tough decisions moving forward if it wants to help reinvigorate the PC market".

Message.Title: Exclusive Games - XBox One leads PS4 2 to 1
Message.Msg: Why do gamers buy a box? To play games of course. With XBox One having twice as many exclusive games, you have to figure in the end that alone will lead to XBox One dominating the market. And with MSFT's moves to appease developers, I think Mister Softy's lead in the exclusive game category will grow, leaving Sony and PS4 in the dust. I understand the knee jerk reaction of the market is to favor PS4 over XBox One due to restrictions MSFT has put in place... But in the end there is NOTHING more restrictive than not having the best games to play. And that is one restriction PS4 will likely never be able to overcome versus XBox One. With the undisputed lead in exclusive games, MSFT put restrictions in place because they can. When push comes to shove, I think most gamers will want the box with the best games. That will be XBox One all the way.

Message.Title: FOR NON FOX NEWS VIEWERS. ( AS THEY CAN'T READ.)
Message.Msg: Alec Baldwin, Matt Damon and John Cusack are among an array of A-list actors starring in a new video urging President Barack Obama to "set the world's course" for an end to nuclear weapons at next week's G8 Summit in Northern Ireland. "Some argue that the spread of these weapons cannot be stopped, cannot be checked," actor Robert De Niro says in the video. "Such fatalism is a deadly adversary," Damon responds. Whoopi Goldberg, Morgan Freeman, Naomi Watts and Christoph Waltz also appear in the two-and-a-half minute spot. The video was produced by Global Zero, a Washington, D.C.-based grassroots organization whose mission is "to eliminate all nuclear weapons by 2030." “The message from national security experts and citizens around the world is clear: the only way to eliminate the global nuclear danger is to eliminate all nuclear weapons,” Michael Douglas says. “It's time to set the world's course to zero.” To do so, Global Zero said in a press release, President Obama "will have to go beyond the bilateral process President Reagan started of U.S.-Soviet/Russian arms reductions and bring the other leading nuclear powers into international arms negotiations for the first time in history." The group also sent an open letter to Obama recalling a 2009 speech in which the president committed to their cause.

Message.Msg: XBOX ONE is a gaming, entertainment, Windows 8 PC all in one. People do not realize that it is actually going to look and perform like your Windows 8 computer except it controls your TV. The voice commands will be irresistible. The Stephen Spielberg looks pretty impressive and I am not into that at all. Seeing the experience and how it makes you feel like you are there was interesting anyway. The NFL experience is the big one. Every football fan will get this. Where I live, you have to pay the cable people extra to see the home team. You have to get a NFL package if you want all the games. Microsoft nailed it with the NFL exclusive. That will sell the hell out of this plus the massive demand by gamers. There is one more thing, businesses will by it also for the easy as 123 group conferencing in HD. Does anyone know how much businesses pay to have that done??? This will sell big.
